channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Large Language Models for Cryptocurrency Transaction Analysis: A Bitcoin Case Study
item.description: Cryptocurrencies are widely used, yet current methods for analyzing transactions heavily rely on opaque, black-box models.

item.title: GDformer: Going Beyond Subsequence Isolation for Multivariate Time Series Anomaly Detection
item.description: Unsupervised anomaly detection of multivariate time series is a challenging task, given the requirements of deriving a compact detection criterion without accessing the anomaly points.

item.title: PDE-DKL: PDE-constrained deep kernel learning in high dimensionality
item.description: This synergy unifies the strengths of both NNs and GPs, yielding high accuracy, robust uncertainty estimates, and computational efficiency for high-dimensional PDEs.

item.title: Illusions of Relevance: Using Content Injection Attacks to Deceive Retrievers, Rerankers, and LLM Judges
item.description: Our study systematically examines the factors that influence an attack's success, such as the placement of injected content and the balance between relevant and non-relevant material.

item.title: DeepFRC: An End-to-End Deep Learning Model for Functional Registration and Classification
item.description: Functional data analysis (FDA) is essential for analyzing continuous, high-dimensional data, yet existing methods often decouple functional registration and classification, limiting their efficiency and performance.

item.title: Prediction-Powered Inference with Imputed Covariates and Nonuniform Sampling
item.description: Machine learning models are increasingly used to produce predictions that serve as input data in subsequent statistical analyses.

item.title: Advances in Multimodal Adaptation and Generalization: From Traditional Approaches to Foundation Models
item.description: Besides, the recent advent of large-scale pre-trained multimodal foundation models, such as CLIP, has inspired works leveraging these models to enhance adaptation and generalization performances or adapting them to downstream tasks.

item.title: A Benchmark and Evaluation for Real-World Out-of-Distribution Detection Using Vision-Language Models
item.description: Our experiments reveal that recent CLIP-based OOD detection methods struggle to varying degrees across the three proposed benchmarks, and none of them consistently outperforms the others.

item.title: Free-T2M: Frequency Enhanced Text-to-Motion Diffusion Model With Consistency Loss
item.description: Rapid progress in text-to-motion generation has been largely driven by diffusion models.

item.title: ReactEmbed: A Cross-Domain Framework for Protein-Molecule Representation Learning via Biochemical Reaction Networks
item.description: The challenge in computational biology and drug discovery lies in creating comprehensive representations of proteins and molecules that capture their intrinsic properties and interactions.

item.title: Track-On: Transformer-based Online Point Tracking with Memory
item.description: In this paper, we consider the problem of long-term point tracking, which requires consistent identification of points across multiple frames in a video, despite changes in appearance, lighting, perspective, and occlusions.

item.title: Estimating Multi-chirp Parameters using Curvature-guided Langevin Monte Carlo
item.description: This paper considers the problem of estimating chirp parameters from a noisy mixture of chirps.

item.title: WILDCHAT-50M: A Deep Dive Into the Role of Synthetic Data in Post-Training
item.description: Language model (LLM) post-training, from DPO to distillation, can refine behaviors and unlock new skills, but the open science supporting these post-training techniques is still in its infancy.

item.title: Scattering approach to diffusion quantifies axonal damage in brain injury
item.description: Early diagnosis and noninvasive monitoring of neurological disorders require sensitivity to elusive cellular-level alterations that occur much earlier than volumetric changes observable with the millimeter-resolution of medical imaging modalities.

item.title: Random Feature Representation Boosting
item.description: We introduce Random Feature Representation Boosting (RFRBoost), a novel method for constructing deep residual random feature neural networks (RFNNs) using boosting theory.

item.title: UDC-VIT: A Real-World Video Dataset for Under-Display Cameras
item.description: In this paper, we propose a real-world UDC video dataset called UDC-VIT.

item.title: adabmDCA 2.0 -- a flexible but easy-to-use package for Direct Coupling Analysis
item.description: In this methods article, we provide a flexible but easy-to-use implementation of Direct Coupling Analysis (DCA) based on Boltzmann machine learning, together with a tutorial on how to use it.

item.title: How to Select Datapoints for Efficient Human Evaluation of NLG Models?
item.description: Human evaluation is the gold-standard for evaluating text generation models.

item.title: Resampling Filter Design for Multirate Neural Audio Effect Processing
item.description: Furthermore, we investigate interpolation and decimation filters for the task of integer oversampling and show that cascaded half-band IIR and FIR designs can be used in conjunction with the model adjustment method to reduce aliasing in a range of distortion effect models.

item.title: LLMs can see and hear without any training
item.description: We present MILS: Multimodal Iterative LLM Solver, a surprisingly simple, training-free approach, to imbue multimodal capabilities into your favorite LLM.

item.title: Efficient Neural Theorem Proving via Fine-grained Proof Structure Analysis
item.description: The superiority of our method is validated on the miniF2F-test benchmark using the open-source deepseek-math-7b-base model and the Isabelle proof assistant.

item.title: Efficient Transformer for High Resolution Image Motion Deblurring
item.description: We also provide detailed ablation studies analyzing the impact of our modifications on model behavior and performance.

item.title: Sebra: Debiasing Through Self-Guided Bias Ranking
item.description: Ranking samples by fine-grained estimates of spuriosity (the degree to which spurious cues are present) has recently been shown to significantly benefit bias mitigation, over the traditional binary biased-\textit{vs}-unbiased partitioning of train sets.

item.title: A Video-grounded Dialogue Dataset and Metric for Event-driven Activities
item.description: This paper presents VDAct, a dataset for a Video-grounded Dialogue on Event-driven Activities, alongside VDEval, a session-based context evaluation metric specially designed for the task.

item.title: VQLTI: Long-Term Tropical Cyclone Intensity Forecasting with Physical Constraints
item.description: (2) Incorporating physical knowledge and physical constraints can help mitigate the accumulation of forecasting errors.

item.title: No Equations Needed: Learning System Dynamics Without Relying on Closed-Form ODEs
item.description: Discovery of closed-form ordinary differential equations (ODEs) can be employed to obtain such insights by finding a compact mathematical equation and then analyzing it (a two-step approach).

item.title: Differentially Private Steering for Large Language Model Alignment
item.description: We also develop the first Membership Inference Attack (MIA) for evaluating and auditing the empirical privacy for the problem of LLM steering via activation editing.

item.title: GuardReasoner: Towards Reasoning-based LLM Safeguards
item.description: Then, we introduce reasoning SFT to unlock the reasoning capability of guard models.

item.title: Panacea: Mitigating Harmful Fine-tuning for Large Language Models via Post-fine-tuning Perturbation
item.description: Mainstream defenses aim to vaccinate the model such that the later harmful fine-tuning attack is less effective.

item.title: Improving Minimax Group Fairness in Sequential Recommendation
item.description: Our contributions include (i) a novel application of CVaR to recommenders, (ii) showing that the DRO methods improve group metrics as well as overall performance, and (iii) demonstrating CVaR's effectiveness in the practical scenario of intersecting user groups.

item.title: A Cartesian Encoding Graph Neural Network for Crystal Structures Property Prediction: Application to Thermal Ellipsoid Estimation
item.description: In diffraction-based crystal structure analysis, thermal ellipsoids, quantified via Anisotropic Displacement Parameters (ADPs), are critical yet challenging to determine.

item.title: Input layer regularization and automated regularization hyperparameter tuning for myelin water estimation using deep learning
item.description: On in vivo brain data, our architecture again outperformed other comparison methods, with GCV proving to be somewhat superior to a NN for regularization parameter selection.

item.title: RbFT: Robust Fine-tuning for Retrieval-Augmented Generation against Retrieval Defects
item.description: Retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) enhances large language models (LLMs) by integrating external knowledge retrieved from a knowledge base.

item.title: Reducing Aleatoric and Epistemic Uncertainty through Multi-modal Data Acquisition
item.description: To generate accurate and reliable predictions, modern AI systems need to combine data from multiple modalities, such as text, images, audio, spreadsheets, and time series.

item.title: Molecular Fingerprints Are Strong Models for Peptide Function Prediction
item.description: We study the effectiveness of molecular fingerprints for peptide property prediction and demonstrate that domain-specific feature extraction from molecular graphs can outperform complex and computationally expensive models such as GNNs, pretrained sequence-based transformers and multimodal ensembles, even without hyperparameter tuning.

item.title: Can Generative LLMs Create Query Variants for Test Collections? An Exploratory Study
item.description: This paper explores the utility of a Large Language Model (LLM) to automatically generate queries and query variants from a description of an information need.

item.title: Large Language Models Think Too Fast To Explore Effectively
item.description: Large Language Models have emerged many intellectual capacities.

item.title: Learning the Optimal Stopping for Early Classification within Finite Horizons via Sequential Probability Ratio Test
item.description: We thus introduce FIRMBOUND, an SPRT-based framework that efficiently estimates the solution to backward induction from training data, bridging the gap between optimal stopping theory and real-world deployment.

item.title: When less is more: evolving large neural networks from small ones
item.description: In contrast to conventional artificial neural networks, which are large and structurally static, we study feed-forward neural networks that are small and dynamic, whose nodes can be added (or subtracted) during training.

item.title: Distilling Knowledge for Designing Computational Imaging Systems
item.description: Our approach involves three steps: (1) Given the original CI system (student), a teacher system is created by relaxing the constraints on the student's encoder.

item.title: Improving Your Model Ranking on Chatbot Arena by Vote Rigging
item.description: We first introduce a straightforward target-only rigging strategy that focuses on new battles involving $m_{t}$, identifying it via watermarking or a binary classifier, and exclusively voting for $m_{t}$ wins.

item.title: Federated Learning With Individualized Privacy Through Client Sampling
item.description: Building on this idea, we propose an adapted method for enabling Individualized Differential Privacy (IDP) in Federated Learning (FL) by handling clients according to their personal privacy preferences.

item.title: DFPE: A Diverse Fingerprint Ensemble for Enhancing LLM Performance
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have shown remarkable capabilities across various natural language processing tasks but often struggle to excel uniformly in diverse or complex domains.

item.title: Uncertainty Quantification and Decomposition for LLM-based Recommendation
item.description: Despite the widespread adoption of large language models (LLMs) for recommendation, we demonstrate that LLMs often exhibit uncertainty in their recommendations.

item.title: Towards Making Flowchart Images Machine Interpretable
item.description: Computer programming textbooks and software documentations often contain flowcharts to illustrate the flow of an algorithm or procedure.

item.title: Is Conversational XAI All You Need? Human-AI Decision Making With a Conversational XAI Assistant
item.description: In comparison to an XAI dashboard, we found that the conversational XAI interface can bring about a better understanding of the AI system among users and higher user trust.

item.title: Analysis of Neural Activation in Time-dependent Membrane Capacitance Models
item.description: Most models of neurons incorporate a capacitor to account for the marked capacitive behavior exhibited by the cell membrane.

item.title: KNN and K-means in Gini Prametric Spaces
item.description: This paper introduces innovative enhancements to the K-means and K-nearest neighbors (KNN) algorithms based on the concept of Gini prametric spaces.

item.title: Noise-Adaptive Conformal Classification with Marginal Coverage
item.description: Conformal inference provides a rigorous statistical framework for uncertainty quantification in machine learning, enabling well-calibrated prediction sets with precise coverage guarantees for any classification model.

item.title: Variational Combinatorial Sequential Monte Carlo for Bayesian Phylogenetics in Hyperbolic Space
item.description: Hyperbolic space naturally encodes hierarchical structures such as phylogenies (binary trees), where inward-bending geodesics reflect paths through least common ancestors, and the exponential growth of neighborhoods mirrors the super-exponential scaling of topologies.
